\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{references/_backend:backend.States.TmpDirRegister.__init__}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{basename}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Class to hold a register of temporary directories. This means that
temporary directories are particular to the given invocation of
baggins, and can be cleaned up at exit without affecting the
temporary directories of other invocations running concurrently.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{basename}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{path\sphinxhyphen{}like}}) \textendash{} base temporary directory path to which a timestamp will be appended

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures

Make a new temporary directory, and add it to the register

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsubsection{analysis.masks module}
\label{\detokenize{references/analysis:module-analysis.masks}}\label{\detokenize{references/analysis:analysis-masks-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!analysis.masks@\spxentry{analysis.masks}}\index{analysis.masks@\spxentry{analysis.masks}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{get\_all\_id\_masks() (in module analysis.masks)@\spxentry{get\_all\_id\_masks()}\spxextra{in module analysis.masks}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{references/analysis:analysis.masks.get_all_id_masks}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{analysis.masks.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_all\_id\_masks}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{snap}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{family}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}stars\textquotesingle{}}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return a dict of masks that mask the chosen particles by ID number to a
specific galaxy, assuming each galaxy has a single SMBH in it.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{snap}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.Snapshot}}) \textendash{} snapshot to mask

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{family}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} particle type we want to mask, by default ‘stars’

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{masks} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{dict})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{keys corresponding to the host galaxy SMBH particle ID, values to pygad.}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{snapshot.masks.IDMask objects}

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_all\_radial\_masks() (in module analysis.masks)@\spxentry{get\_all\_radial\_masks()}\spxextra{in module analysis.masks}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{references/analysis:analysis.masks.get_all_radial_masks}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{analysis.masks.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_all\_radial\_masks}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{snap}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{radius}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{centre}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{id\_masks}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{family}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}stars\textquotesingle{}}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return a dict of masks that mask the chosen particles by radial distance to
the desired centre. Either a ball mask or a shell mask may be constructed.
Additionally, the option to initially filter particles by ID to constrain
the mask to those particles belonging to a given galaxy is possible.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{snap}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.Snapshot}}) \textendash{} snapshot to mask

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{radius}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}) \textendash{} radius to constrain the particles to \sphinxhyphen{} can be either a number to
construct a ball mask, or a tuple of (inner\_radius, outer\_radius)
to construct a shell mask

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{centre}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.UnitArr}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} centre from which the radial measurements should be made, by default
None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_mask}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} ID masks to constrain particles to a given galaxy, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{family}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} particle type to construct the mask for, by default None (all particle
used)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{masks} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{dict}) \textendash{} pygad mask objects, with keys corresponding to the host galaxy SMBH
particle ID number

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ValueError}} \textendash{} centre method is invalid

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_binding\_energy\_mask() (in module analysis.masks)@\spxentry{get\_binding\_energy\_mask()}\spxextra{in module analysis.masks}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{references/analysis:analysis.masks.get_binding_energy_mask}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{analysis.masks.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_binding\_energy\_mask}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{snap}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{energy}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{id\_mask}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{family}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Mask particles into bins of binding energy. Assumes that we are in centre of mass coordinates (including velocity): no centring is done.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{snap}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.Snapshot}}) \textendash{} snapshot to mask

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{energy}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\sphinxhyphen{}like}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ of }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuples}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} energy bins to mask particles into \sphinxhyphen{}  can either be a regular array, in
which a “ball” mask is created, or a list of tuples, in which a “shell”
mask is created. By default (None) creates a “shell” type mask from the
5\% to 95\% quantile of binding energy in 20 bins evenly spaced in
logscale

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_mask}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.snapshot.masks.IDMask}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} ID mask to constrain particles to a given galaxy, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{family}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{\_type\_}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} particle type we want to mask, by default None (all)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Yields}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{mask} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{pygad.snapshots.mask.IDMask}) \textendash{} mask for that energy interval

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{energy} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{array\sphinxhyphen{}like, list of tuples}) \textendash{} energy sequence

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{str} \textendash{} energy units

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ValueError}} \textendash{} invalid energy input

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_id\_mask() (in module analysis.masks)@\spxentry{get\_id\_mask()}\spxextra{in module analysis.masks}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{references/analysis:analysis.masks.get_id_mask}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{analysis.masks.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_id\_mask}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{snap}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{bhid}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{family}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}stars\textquotesingle{}}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Obtain a mask that allows filtering of particular particles. Particles are
first filtered to the host galaxy depending on their particle ID number,
where it is necessarily assumed that the particle ID ordering follows:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
galaxy 1 IDs \textendash{}\textgreater{} galaxy 2 IDs
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
To obtain a mask of all particles in a system, the routine can be run
for each particle family, and the masks combined as e.g.:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
all\_id\_mask = star\_id\_mask \& dm\_id\_mask \& bh\_id\_mask
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\#TODO should this be a separate method??
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{snap}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.Snapshot}}) \textendash{} snapshot to mask

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{bhid}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} SMBH id number we want to find particles around

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{family}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} particle type we want to mask, by default ‘stars’

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{pygad.snapshot.masks.IDMask} \textendash{} object to mask future snapshots of the same simulation

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{RuntimeError}} \textendash{} ID ordering is not divided by galaxy

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{RuntimeError}} \textendash{} only galaxy in the system

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_radial\_mask() (in module analysis.masks)@\spxentry{get\_radial\_mask()}\spxextra{in module analysis.masks}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{references/analysis:analysis.masks.get_radial_mask}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{analysis.masks.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_radial\_mask}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{snap}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{radius}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{centre}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{id\_mask}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{family}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a radial\sphinxhyphen{}based mask, can be either a ball or a shell. The default
function arguments are designed for compatability with get\_all\_radial\_masks.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{snap}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.Snapshot}}) \textendash{} snapshot to mask

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{radius}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}) \textendash{} radius to constrain the particles to \sphinxhyphen{} can be either a number to
construct a ball mask, or a tuple of (inner\_radius, outer\_radius)
to construct a shell mask

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{centre}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.UnitArr}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} centre from which the radial measurements should be made, by default
None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_mask}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pygad.snapshot.masks.IDMask}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} ID mask to constrain particles to a given galaxy, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{family}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} particle type to construct the mask for, by default None (all particle
used)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{mask} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{pygad.snapshot.masks.BallMask}) \textendash{} radial mask of particles

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ValueError}} \textendash{} radius input is invalid

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
